definition.name: Slider
definition.description: A customizable slider component built on top of Radix UI's Slider primitive. It provides a user interface element for selecting a value from a range of values by dragging a thumb along a track. The component includes visual feedback for different states including hover, focus, and disabled states.

className.description: Additional CSS classes to apply to the slider root element

defaultValue.description: The initial value of the slider

value.description: The controlled value of the slider

onValueChange.description: Callback function called when the slider value changes

min.description: The minimum value of the slider

max.description: The maximum value of the slider

step.description: The step value of the slider

interactions: Click and drag the thumb to change the value
Click anywhere on the track to jump to that value
Use arrow keys to adjust the value when the thumb is focused
Tab to focus the slider thumb
definition.visualLayout: The slider consists of a horizontal track with a colored range indicating the selected value. A draggable thumb element can be moved along the track to adjust the value. The track has a background color with reduced opacity, while the range portion has full opacity. The thumb is a circular button with a border and shadow, featuring focus and disabled states.
definition.implementationNotes: This component is built using Radix UI's Slider primitive components and uses the cn utility for class name management. It forwards refs and preserves all Radix UI Slider props through prop spreading.
